intro: Chamaesyce setosa, commonly known as the rough sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit and is native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. The plant features small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in early spring, and its leaves are covered in fine, stiff hairs, giving it a rough texture. Chamaesyce setosa thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. It is a hardy species that is well adapted to drought conditions.
